sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumseh Salako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia's defense ministry reports it's begun to pull troops away from the Ukraine border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Could this be the beginning of the end of the crisis?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We'll have the latest from Moscow too as Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz meets Russia's President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz meets Russia's President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And breaking his silence, the world number one tennis player Novak Djokovic explains why his freedom to choose not to be vaccinated is more important than winning more titles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There appears to be positive news coming out from Moscow, but caution must remain the watchword.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However, Ukraine's foreign minister, Dmytro Kuleba, has hailed reports of Russia's troop withdrawal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Let's get more now from our correspondent in the Ukraine capital, Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's Sasha Vakulina.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Sasha, we can understand the foreign minister breathing a sigh of relief, but is that sentiment widely shared?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Tell us more. What more do we know?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: but is that sentiment widely shared tell us more what more do we know I'm not even sure talks how its charity in the ministries in Ukraine here in Kiev the feeling about all the recent the recent developments and these headlines about the possible withdrawal the feeling among the politicians among the decision-makers among the people here in Ukraine is very, very cautious. Dmytro Kuleba also sat today reacting to this possible news, saying that we will believe it when we have proofs. And that's the mood that you can hear from the administration of the president of Ukraine as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Are they optimistic?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Of course they are, but they're even more cautious.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Sasha, tell us more about what the general mood is ahead of tomorrow's National Day of Unity, as called by President Zelensky.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In the past few days, we heard of course from Ukrainian leaders saying that in some ways blaming the West for stoking or raising tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Well you can see Kiev main square right here behind me. I'm going to just take a step back so you can see it. It's a beautiful day today, and the square is packed with people. They're just going after daily lives. They're going to work, they're going shopping. Life goes on here, and people have the feeling of resilience. I would say that's the main feeling that I've got to hear from them here while being in Ukraine's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Look, they have been living with the pressure, of course, for years, as we all know. And now, with the recent escalation, there's been more tension, there's been more pressure, and they've been feeling it, of course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They've been more concerned about what's coming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They've been thinking what to do, how to react.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Mostly people were saying that they are going to stay in Ukraine, whatever happens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And I would say this is a very consolidated society and tomorrow's uh Unity Day which was announced by Vladimir zelensky will just show that Western expats are finding it hard to leave Ukraine. It follows countries including the US, the UK and Germany

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: urging their citizens to leave over the tensions between Kiev and Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Some fear there is too much to lose if they leave too soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: People think that, you know, since you're an expat, that you can just up and leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A lot of people like myself have made their lives here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's not like I arrived yesterday, I'm on holiday for a week and I can come back to England. I still have family in England. I'm 52 years old. I'm not 18 and I'm not really wanting to couch surf with my wife in England. You know, there's a bigger picture to it here. Of course, you know, if things really get serious, yeah, one has to think about doing the right thing this father of two has lived in ukraine for over 20 years and doesn't believe in a war even though his country the us has been the first to announce the relocation of its embassy there's no lines to buy gas the stores people are buying things as normal there's no rush to buy flour or anything like that so life is So life is just going on and I think that we all expect that hopefully a year from now or a couple of months from now or maybe even a couple of weeks from now or maybe even this week there will be some sort of overall solution and the situation will become less tense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Several airlines have been cancelling or diverting flights to Kyiv, such as Dutch company KLM, who has suspended its air traffic until further notice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Switzerland, the Parliament of the City of Geneva wants to grant a 20% discount to women for entrance to public facilities, whether sports or cultural, to compensate for wage discrimination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The motion was passed with the majority of the centre and left, but at council level the proposal was defeated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The government now has to come up with a new proposal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Donald Trump's long-time accountancy firm has cut its ties with his business. proposal. The move comes amid ongoing criminal and civil investigations into whether Trump illegally inflated the value of his assets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Pharmaceutical drugs are polluting rivers worldwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to a study published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Researchers surveyed more than 1,000 sites from the Thames in London to the Brazilian Amazon, Delhi and New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Paracetamol, antibiotics and an anti-epileptic drug have all been found posing a threat to wildlife.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of nurses in Australia's New South Wales have gone on strike to protest staff shortages and stagnant pay. In their demands, they asked for mandated nurse-to-patient ratios and a pay rise higher than 2.5%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The strike proceeded despite a last-minute order from the Industrial Relations Commission to call off the action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Tonight, Paris Saint-Germain will be facing Real Madrid in the Champions League,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: with both teams looking to secure an advantage in their first leg of their last 16 tie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This is a crucial match for the French giants, who are desperate to finally lift the European Cup after being finalist in 2020 and semi-finalist in 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the game against the 13-time winner Real Madrid will be tough. It's a knockout game that could also be the Champions League final because of the name of the two teams, the players and the quality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Paris has been waiting more than 50 years to win this title and we are the aspirants." Both teams have some of the best players in the world and will probably see two of their star members coming back after injuries, that is Neymar on Paris' side and Madrid's Karim Benzema.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: After meeting in the Parc des Princes, the two rivals will face each other again at the Santiago Bernabeu for the return leg in three weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the dead of winter, an icy village comes to life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: 123 igloos rose up from the frozen Ob Sea in central Russia as the 7th annual Igloo Festival got underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: frozen Ob Sea in central Russia, as the seventh annual Igloo Festival got underway. Hundreds of people are competing to build the best, most beautiful or biggest snow house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But it's not all fun and games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The real competitors here have a strategy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There is a technique to building an igloo, that is, the blocks are cut correctly, they are all fitted, there are no gaps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the gaps aren't just filled with snow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The entire snail and keystone on top are assembled correctly, meaning they shouldn't pile them up, they should not close it with some kind of slab.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But all these things should be done evenly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: X-shaped igloos are mostly done by beginners. They're afraid to round the igloo off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Each team is given two and a half hours to complete their construction. The oldest participant is 72 and the youngest only two years old. Many come with their whole families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And even if they don't win a prize for the biggest or most correctly built igloo, they could always take home the spectator award for best team.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We went with friends for the first time and failed. We were upset and decided that it should definitely work out. And then, for the third time last year, just the two of us made the whole igloo on our own. And now we have a big team here, so we have made a bigger igloo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Igloo Festival has grown in popularity each year, with more and more participants braving the cold. The most courageous of them even slept in their igloos overnight.
